en: A black and white photograph of Alfred Jackson's son Gus with two  yet to be indentified descendents of Alfred in the south room of Alfred's Cabin.  Gus is seated in a rocking chair at left while a younger woman sits in a chair to the right with a young child standing next to her.  Shows four poster bed in SE corner, rocking chair, two tables, trunk, chest, water cooler.  A clock and lamp also appear in the picture.  Image is mounted to grey cardboard with a black stripe around the image.  "Thuss/Nashville, Tenn" is imbossed on the lower left hand corner of the print.
Era 7 - The Emergence of Modern America (1890-1930)
